documents.title: Gemini CLI Architecture Overview
documents.summary: Overview of the Gemini CLI architecture, detailing the interaction between the user-facing CLI package, the core backend package, and the extensible tool system.

documents.title: Contribution Guide
documents.summary: Information for contributors on how to set up, build, test, and contribute to the Gemini CLI project.

documents.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
documents.summary: Answers to common questions regarding API errors, installation, platform-specific issues, and configuration for Gemini CLI.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Documentation Home
documents.summary: The landing page for the Gemini CLI documentation, providing a roadmap for overview, getting started, CLI commands, core logic, tools, extensions, and support.

documents.title: Integration Testing Framework
documents.summary: Detailed documentation on the integration testing framework, including building, running, and debugging end-to-end tests for the Gemini CLI.

documents.title: Issue and PR Automation Workflows
documents.summary: An overview of the automated triage, CI, and release processes used to manage issues and pull requests in the Gemini CLI repository.

documents.title: Local Development and Tracing Guide
documents.summary: Instructions for setting up local development features, specifically focusing on enabling and viewing development traces using Genkit or Jaeger.

documents.title: NPM Package Structure and Workspaces
documents.summary: Explanation of the project's monorepo structure, detailing the @google/gemini-cli and @google/gemini-cli-core packages and how NPM workspaces are used.

documents.title: Quotas and Pricing Information
documents.summary: Details on the various pricing tiers and quotas for Gemini CLI, including free usage, paid tiers, and pay-as-you-go options.

documents.title: Release Confidence and Quality Strategy
documents.summary: Outline of the strategy for ensuring high-quality releases through automated gates, manual verification (dogfooding), and telemetry reviews.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Release Flow and Cadence
documents.summary: Overview of the release process, covering dev/prod environments, release tags (stable, preview, nightly), weekly promotion flows, and patching procedures.

documents.title: License, Terms of Service, and Privacy Notices
documents.summary: Documentation on the Apache 2.0 license, supported authentication methods, and the relevant Terms of Service and Privacy Notices for Google's AI services.

documents.title: Troubleshooting Guide and Common Errors
documents.summary: Solutions for authentication errors, network issues, and common CLI failures, along with debugging tips and a list of exit codes for automation.

documents.title: Release Notes and Major Announcements
documents.summary: Central hub for release notes across different channels (nightly, preview, stable), including highlights from recent major versions like v0.26.0 and v0.25.0.

documents.title: Latest Stable Release Notes (v0.26.0)
documents.summary: Detailed highlights and a full list of changes for the v0.26.0 stable release, featuring enhanced agent capabilities and UI/UX improvements.

documents.title: Preview Release Notes (v0.27.0-preview.0)
documents.summary: Highlights and change log for the latest preview release, introducing event-driven architecture, system prompt overrides, and a new rewind command.

documents.title: Authentication Setup Reference
documents.summary: A brief reference pointing to the comprehensive authentication setup guide in the getting started section.

documents.title: Project Checkpointing and Restoration
documents.summary: Documentation on the Checkpointing feature, which automatically snapshots project state and conversation history before AI modifications, allowing for easy restoration.

documents.title: CLI Command and Options Cheatsheet
documents.summary: A quick reference guide for commonly used Gemini CLI commands, positional arguments, global options, model selection, and extension management.

documents.title: Built-in Slash, At, and Passthrough Commands
documents.summary: Exhaustive list of built-in commands for session management, context injection using @, and direct shell interaction using !.

documents.title: Guide to Creating Agent Skills
documents.summary: Instructions on extending Gemini CLI using Agent Skills, highlighting the use of the skill-creator tool and the manual creation process including folder structure and SKILL.md metadata.

documents.title: Configuring Custom Commands
documents.summary: Comprehensive guide on creating personal shortcuts using TOML files, covering argument handling via {{args}}, shell command execution with !{...}, and file content injection with @{...}.

documents.title: Enterprise Deployment and Management
documents.summary: Best practices for managing Gemini CLI in corporate environments, including centralized configuration, restricting tool access through allowlists, enforcing sandboxing, and telemetry auditing.

documents.title: Ignoring Files with .geminiignore
documents.summary: Explanation of the .geminiignore feature, which uses standard glob patterns to exclude specific files and directories from AI-powered tools and context sharing.

documents.title: Instructional Context with GEMINI.md
documents.summary: How to provide persistent project-specific instructions and personas using GEMINI.md context files, including the hierarchical loading system and the /memory management command.

documents.title: Advanced Model Generation Configuration
documents.summary: Technical guide for power users on managing hyperparameters like temperature and topP using a system of configuration aliases and conditional overrides.

documents.title: Headless Mode and Automation
documents.summary: Guide to running Gemini CLI programmatically for scripting and CI/CD pipelines, supporting direct prompts, stdin piping, and structured JSON/JSONL output formats.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Frontend Overview
documents.summary: Introduction to the packages/cli frontend, summarizing its basic features like model selection and settings, as well as advanced features like agent skills and sandboxing.

documents.title: Complete Keyboard Shortcut Reference
documents.summary: A comprehensive list of keyboard shortcuts for cursor movement, text editing, scrolling, history search, and application-level controls like toggling YOLO mode.

documents.title: Automatic Model Routing and Fallbacks
documents.summary: Overview of the model routing feature that provides resilience by automatically prompting for or silently switching to fallback models in case of primary model failures.

documents.title: Model Selection with /model Command
documents.summary: Instructions on using the /model command to choose between Pro, Flash, and Auto settings, with notes on Gemini 3 access and the impact on sub-agents.

documents.title: Rewinding Conversation and Code Changes
documents.summary: Documentation for the /rewind command, which enables users to revert conversation history and AI-driven file modifications to a previous state.

documents.title: Sandboxing Guide for Secure Execution
documents.summary: Overview of sandboxing methods including macOS Seatbelt and container-based (Docker/Podman) solutions to isolate potentially dangerous operations from the host system.

documents.title: Persistent Session Management
documents.summary: Explanation of how Gemini CLI automatically saves sessions, how to resume them via the command line or session browser, and how to configure retention and turn limits.

documents.title: Comprehensive Settings Reference
documents.summary: A full guide to all available Gemini CLI settings, covering general options, UI customization, model parameters, tool behavior, and security configurations.

documents.title: Extending Capabilities with Agent Skills
documents.summary: Introduction to the Agent Skills standard, detailing how expertise is discovered from workspace, user, and extension tiers, and how it is activated autonomously by Gemini.

documents.title: System Prompt Override (GEMINI_SYSTEM_MD)
documents.summary: Guide for advanced users on completely replacing the core system instructions using an external Markdown file and environment variables, including variable substitution.

documents.title: Observability and Telemetry Documentation
documents.summary: Detailed guide on enabling OpenTelemetry for usage analytics, performance monitoring, and debugging, supporting both local and Google Cloud export targets.

documents.title: Customizing Appearance with Themes
documents.summary: Instructions on changing pre-defined dark and light themes using the /theme command and how to define custom color themes in the settings.json file.

documents.title: Token Caching and Cost Optimization
documents.summary: Overview of how Gemini CLI reuses system instructions and context to reduce API costs for API key and Vertex AI users.

documents.title: Security with Trusted Folders
documents.summary: Explanation of the Trusted Folders feature, which prevents malicious code execution by asking for approval before loading project-specific settings and custom tools from a directory.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Tutorials Index
documents.summary: A collection of tutorials covering Agent Skills and setting up Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, with a focus on interacting with GitHub.

documents.title: Uninstalling Gemini CLI
documents.summary: Step-by-step instructions for removing the CLI when installed via npx, npm global, Homebrew, or MacPorts.

documents.title: Tutorial: Getting Started with Agent Skills
documents.summary: A hands-on guide to creating an 'API Auditor' skill, covering directory structure, SKILL.md instructions, and bundling a Node.js script for the agent to execute.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Core Backend Overview
documents.summary: Introduction to the packages/core backend, detailing its responsibilities in API communication, prompt engineering, tool orchestration, and state management.

documents.title: Modular Context with Memory Import Processor
documents.summary: Documentation on the @file.md import syntax for GEMINI.md files, enabling modular context with built-in safety features like circular import detection.

documents.title: Fine-grained Tool Control with Policy Engine
documents.summary: Detailed guide on the policy engine, which uses a priority-based rule system to allow, deny, or prompt for tool execution based on tool names and argument patterns.

documents.title: Connecting to Remote Subagents (A2A)
documents.summary: Experimental feature documentation for interacting with external agents using the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol, including configuration and definition patterns.

documents.title: Specialized Context with Sub-agents
documents.summary: Overview of sub-agents as task-specific specialists with their own context windows and toolsets, highlighting built-in agents like codebase_investigator and cli_help.

documents.title: Core Tools API and Execution Flow
documents.summary: Technical overview of the internal tools API, defining the contract for tools, the registration process in the tool registry, and the full execution lifecycle from model request to result display.

documents.title: Example Proxy Script for Sandboxing
documents.summary: A reference Node.js script for creating a custom HTTPS proxy to be used with the GEMINI_SANDBOX_PROXY_COMMAND environment variable.

documents.title: Best Practices for Extension Development
documents.summary: Guidance on structuring extensions, securing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, and using semantic versioning for releases.

documents.title: Overview of Gemini CLI Extensions
documents.summary: Introduction to extensions as packages for prompts, MCP servers, and skills, with links to the gallery and installation guides.

documents.title: Extensions Command and Format Reference
documents.summary: Detailed documentation on the gemini extensions command suite and the structure of the gemini-extension.json manifest file.

documents.title: Guide to Releasing Extensions
documents.summary: Explanation of release methods via Git repositories or GitHub Releases, including instructions for platform-specific archives and versioning.

documents.title: Tutorial: Writing Your First Extension
documents.summary: A step-by-step guide to building a Gemini CLI extension, covering MCP server setup, custom commands, and bundling specialized expertise.

documents.title: Authentication Setup and Methods
documents.summary: Comprehensive guide to signing in with Google, using Gemini API keys, or authenticating via Vertex AI for different user scenarios.

documents.title: Legacy Configuration (v1) Documentation
documents.summary: Reference for the deprecated v1 settings.json format, including configuration layers and available legacy settings.

documents.title: Configuring Gemini CLI (v2 Format)
documents.summary: Current guide to the organized nested structure of settings.json, environment variables, and command-line arguments.

documents.title: Real-world Usage Examples
documents.summary: Practical scenarios demonstrating Gemini CLI's capabilities in file renaming, code explanation, data processing, and unit test generation.

documents.title: Getting Started with Gemini 3
documents.summary: Instructions on enabling Gemini 3 Pro and Flash via preview features, including details on usage limits, fallback mechanisms, and routing types.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Quickstart Guide
documents.summary: Overview of the installation, authentication, and configuration steps required to start using Gemini CLI.

documents.title: Installation and Deployment Architecture
documents.summary: Guide to standard installation, running in a sandbox, or from source, with technical details on the monorepo structure and release process.

documents.title: Best Practices for Hook Development
documents.summary: Comprehensive guidelines on optimizing hook performance, debugging synchronously running scripts, and ensuring security when using project-level hooks.

documents.title: Introduction to Gemini CLI Hooks
documents.summary: Overview of hooks as scripts that execute at specific lifecycle events to add context, validate actions, or enforce security policies.

documents.title: Hooks Technical Reference and Schemas
documents.summary: Detailed technical specification of hook mechanics, configuration schemas, input/output fields, and specific event behaviors for tools, agents, and models.

documents.title: Step-by-step Guide to Writing Hooks
documents.summary: Tutorial on creating logging, security, and context-injection hooks, including a complete example of a 'Smart Development Workflow Assistant.'

documents.title: IDE Companion Plugin Specification
documents.summary: Interface specification for building companion plugins for different editors, covering MCP over HTTP communication and the context/diffing interfaces.

documents.title: IDE Integration and Native Diffing
documents.summary: Overview of how Gemini CLI integrates with IDEs like VS Code to provide workspace awareness and seamless in-editor code review and modification.

documents.title: File System Tools Documentation
documents.summary: Detailed reference for tools like list_directory, read_file, write_file, and replace used by Gemini to interact with the local workspace.

documents.title: Gemini CLI Tools Overview
documents.summary: Introduction to built-in tools used by the Gemini model to interact with the local environment, access information, and perform actions under user control.

documents.title: Integrating MCP Servers
documents.summary: Comprehensive guide to Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, covering discovery, transport mechanisms (Stdio, SSE, HTTP), and configuration for extending Gemini's toolset.

documents.title: Persistence with save_memory Tool
documents.summary: Instructions on using the save_memory tool to direct the CLI to remember key details across sessions by appending them to a central Markdown file.

documents.title: System Interaction with run_shell_command
documents.summary: Documentation for executing shell commands, including interactive support via pseudo-terminals and security configurations for restricting specific command prefixes.

documents.title: Task Management with write_todos Tool
documents.summary: Overview of how the agent uses the write_todos tool to manage subtasks for complex requests, providing visibility into its plan and progress.

documents.title: Extracting Information with web_fetch
documents.summary: Guide to using the web_fetch tool to retrieve and process content from up to 20 URLs, supporting summarization and comparison of web pages.

documents.title: Grounding with google_web_search
documents.summary: Explanation of how to perform web searches via the Gemini API to get summarized results with citations and sources.

title: Gemini CLI Documentation Knowledge Base
summary: A comprehensive collection of documentation for the Gemini CLI, covering architecture, installation, configuration, commands, core mechanics, hooks, extensions, and tools.
